definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: Now let me record this transaction in your bankbook.
sentences.chinese: 现在我把这笔账录入到您的存折里。

sentences.english: Please come back to renew your passbook or get your money in seven days.
sentences.chinese: 七天后来补领新存折，也可以提现金。

sentences.english: OK. Please pass me your "Current One-for-All".
sentences.chinese: 请把“活期一本通”存折递给我。

sentences.english: He had his passport and his bankbooks in the back pocket of his pants.
sentences.chinese: 他的裤子后袋里装着他的护照和银行存折。

sentences.english: You should also provide your Current One-for-All passbook or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 您还要提供“活期一本通”存折或信用卡。

sentences.english: The original copy of applicants' Bankbook showing current savings.
sentences.chinese: 申请人的银行存折原件。

sentences.english: I haven't updated my bankbook in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 我有一段时间没有去打印我的银行存折了。

sentences.english: Please fill in this deposit slip and give me your passbook.
sentences.chinese: 请填写这张存款凭条并把您的存折给我。

sentences.english: Here are my bankbook and the drawing slip.
sentences.chinese: 这是我的存折和取款单。

sentences.english: The "held" deposits must be displayed when kids view their passbooks.
sentences.chinese: 当小孩看存折时，必须显示“扣留”的存款。

sentences.english: What if he can't find the passbook?
sentences.chinese: 要是他不能找到存折，该怎么办？

sentences.english: Someone had asked me how much I had in my account. I answered I didn't know.
sentences.chinese: 有人问我我存折里面有多少钱，我也不知道。

sentences.english: All banking transactions will be recorded in your bankbook.
sentences.chinese: 所有的银行交易会记录在你的银行存折上。

sentences.english: May I have a look at your bankbook ?
sentences.chinese: 我可以看一看你的银行存折吗？

sentences.english: Here is your money and passbook.

definition: to deposit money (in a bank etc)/bank savings/bank deposit
to withdraw money from a bank
